bundle.name: backup

description.p: This bundle installs the snapbackup tool on a computer. In most cases you want to install this tool on a computer running Cassandra, especially if your network requires the OpenVPN to create a secure LAN. However, watch out for disk space if you save many backups on the same computer!

WARNING: By default the installation uses 127.0.0.1 as a Cassandra node IP address. If you are not installing snapbackup on a Cassandra node, then make sure to change that IP address or you will not get any backups. A field named backup / host will appear after installation.

field.name: host
field.label: Cassandra Host Address
field.description: Enter one of the host IP addresses (or DNS names) of the Cassandra server cluster.

bundle.postinst: # Now put the HOST ip address into /etc/default/snapbackup # sed -i.bak -e "s/HOST=.*/HOST=${BUNDLE_INSTALLATION_HOST}/" /etc/default/snapbackup
